info.name: Glasswall File Rebuild Product API
info.description: The Rebuild API provides developers the pathway to obtaining safe and secure files.

item.name: Rebuilds a file using its binary data

formdata.description: (Required) The binary contents of the selected file will be uploaded to the server.

request.description:
Description:

This endpoint accepts requests to rebuild a file with the Glasswall Engine. File is sent in the request body with a 'Content-Type' of 'multipart/form-data'. The Rebuilt file is then returned in the response body with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/octet-stream'.

response.name: OK - The requested file was processed by the Glasswall Engine

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the rebuilt file's binary content to the client.

formdata.description: (Required) The binary contents of the selected file will be uploaded to the server.

header.description: This contains the details of the rebuilt files binary data to download.
Name of the machine which processed the request.
Version of the GW SDK Engine.
Version of the Cloud SDK Api.
Adaptation file id.

response.name: Bad Request - This is usually when the input is malformed or missing parameters

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the rebuilt file's binary content to the client.

formdata.description: (Required) The binary contents of the selected file will be uploaded to the server.

header.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.
Version of the GW SDK Engine.
Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

response.name: Internal Server Error - This is usually when something wrong on the server.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the rebuilt file's binary content to the client.

formdata.description: (Required) The binary contents of the selected file will be uploaded to the server.

header.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.
Version of the GW SDK Engine.
Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

response.name: Unsupported Media Type - This happens when the payload format is in an unsupported format. The format problem might be due to the request's indicated Content-Type.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the rebuilt file's binary content to the client.

formdata.description: (Required) The binary contents of the selected file will be uploaded to the server.

header.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.
Version of the GW SDK Engine.
Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

response.name: Method Not Allowed - This happens when an HTTP method is not allowed by a server for a requested URL.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the rebuilt file's binary content to the client.

formdata.description: (Required) The binary contents of the selected file will be uploaded to the server.

header.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.
Version of the GW SDK Engine.

item.name: Rebuilds a file using the Base64 encoded representation

exec: pm.test("Should rebuild file encoded as base64", function () {

request.description: This endpoint accepts requests to rebuild a file with the Glasswall Engine. The request body contains the Base64 representation of the file with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/json'. A Base64 Representation of the rebuilt file is then returned in the response with a 'Content-Type' of 'text/plain'.

response.name: Internal Server Error - This is usually when something wrong on the server.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Name of the machine which processed the request.
Version of the GW SDK Engine.
Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Name of the machine which processed the request.
Version of the GW SDK Engine.
Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

response.name: OK - The requested Base64 was successfully decoded and processed by the Glasswall Engine

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Name of the machine which processed the request.
Version of the GW SDK Engine.
Version of the Cloud SDK Api.
Adaptation file id.

response.name: Method Not Allowed - This happens when an HTTP method is not allowed by a server for a requested URL.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Rebuilds a zip file using its binary data

formdata.description: (Required) The binary contents of the selected zip file will be uploaded to the server.

request.description:
Description:

This endpoint accepts requests to rebuild a zip file with the Glasswall Engine. The file is sent in the request body with a 'Content-Type' of 'multipart/form-data'. Rebuilt zip file is then returned in the response body with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/octet-stream'.

response.name: OK - The requested file was processed by the Glasswall Engine

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the rebuilt file's binary content to the client.

formdata.description: (Required) The binary contents of the selected zip file will be uploaded to the server.

header.description: This contains the details of the rebuilt files binary data to download
Name of the machine which processed the request.
Version of the GW SDK Engine.
Version of the Cloud SDK Api.
Adaptation file id.

response.name: Multi-Status - The requested file was processed with error report by the Glasswall Engine.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the rebuilt file's binary content to the client.

formdata.description: (Required) The binary contents of the selected zip file will be uploaded to the server.

header.description: This contains the details of the rebuilt files and ErrorHtml binary data to download

item.name: Rebuilds a protected zip file using its binary data and password.

exec: pm.test("Should rebuild password protected zip file", function () {

formdata.description: (Required) The binary contents of the selected protected zip file will be uploaded to the server.
(Required) Password for the protected zip file.

request.description:
Description:

This endpoint accepts requests to rebuild a protected zip file with the Glasswall Engine. Both protected file and password are sent in the request body with a 'Content-Type' of 'multipart/form-data'. Rebuilt zip file is then returned in the response body with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/octet-stream'.

response.name: Method Not Allowed - This happens when an HTTP method is not allowed by a server for a requested URL.

A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the rebuilt file's binary content to the client.

(Required) Password for the protected zip file.

The zip file is then returned in the response body with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/octet-stream'.
